body_content.explanation: the fact of refusing to join the armed forces or fight in a war for moral or religious reasons:
examples: Conscientious objection to military service is recognized by the United Nations as a legitimate exercise of the right to freedom of thought, conscience, and religion.
He was not made aware of his rights as a soldier to register a conscientious objection to military service.

body_content.explanation: the fact of refusing to obey a particular order or rule or to do a particular type of work for moral or religious reasons:
examples: Pharmacists must notify their employer if they have a conscientious objection to the dispensing of any drug or class of drugs.
Some doctors exercise the legal right of conscientious objection to not be involved in performing abortions.
